Diff_Mod.Welcome_Message_0: Welcome to AI and Neutral Difficulty Mod
Diff_Mod.confirm_button_hint: Close settings and start the game!
Diff_Mod.RightHint:
{Settings for AI-difficulty}
			
												Here you can set options to increase the strength of the computer player by granting various bonuses. All options can also be accessed and set during the game by right-clicking the system icon on the adventure map.
Diff_Mod.LeftHint:
{Settings for Neutrals-difficulty}
			
												Here you can set options to increase the strength of neutral units on the map. All options can also be accessed and set during the game by right-clicking the system icon on the adventure map.
Diff_Mod.Bonus1:
{Easy - Bonus reward for any computer player}:
						
												Gives AI hero 50% chance of +1 random primary skill point when level up.												
												
												Gives AI player ressources daily 2000 Gold and 1 of every ressources.
												
												Gives AI 5 spell points, 200 movement and 500 experience daily.
												
												Gives AI a slightly better commander.
												
												Gives AI creatures on every second day, they are added to every occupied slot from the hero.
Diff_Mod.Bonus2:
{Medium - Bonus reward for any computer player}:
			
			
												Gives AI hero +1 random primary skill point when level up.
			
												Gives AI player ressources daily 3000 Gold and 2 of every ressources.
												
												Gives AI 10 spell points, 300 movement and 1000 experience daily.
												
												Gives AI a better commander.
												
												Gives AI creatures on every second day! they are added to every occupied slot from the hero.
Diff_Mod.Bonus3:
{Hard - Bonus reward for any computer player}:
			
			
												Gives AI hero +1 or +2 random Primary Skills point when level up.
			
												Gives AI player ressources daily 4000 Gold and 3 of every ressources.
												
												Gives AI 15 spell points, 400 movement and 2500 experience daily.
												
												Gives AI a strong commander.
												
												Gives AI Creatures on every second day! they are added to every occupied slot from the hero.
Diff_Mod.Bonus4:
{Extreme - Bonus reward for any computer player}:
			
			
												Gives AI hero +2 random primary skill points when level up.
			
												Gives AI player ressources daily 5000 Gold and 5 of every ressources.
												
												Gives AI 20 spell points, 500 movement and 5000 experience daily.
												
												Gives AI a powerful commander.
												
												Gives AI creatures on every second day! they are added to every occupied slot from the hero.
Diff_Mod.Bonus5:
{Insane - Bonus reward for any computer player}:
			
			
												Gives AI hero +2 or +3 random primary skill points when level up.
			
												Gives AI player ressources daily 7000 Gold and 6 of every ressources.
												
												Gives AI 25 spell points, 700 movement and 10000 experience daily.
												
												Gives AI a very powerful commander.
												
												Gives AI creatures on {~Red}every{~} day! they are added to every occupied slot from the hero.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Preset_1:
{Easy}			
			
												Will increase the strength of neutral stacks only slight. This setting should be doable for everyone.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Preset_2:
{Normal}			
			
												Will increase the strength and size of neutral stacks on the map. This setting might also activate a few option to make your game harder.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Preset_3:
{~Red}Hard{~}			
			
												Will increase the strength and size of neutral stacks on the map significantly. This setting will activate a several options to make your game harder.
Diff_Mod.Cancel_Neutral_Settings: Exit and reset all neutral settings and close dialogue.
Diff_Mod.ProOnly:
{Insane Difficulty}
			
												This difficulty level is not available from the start because you will need time to develop your hero to stand a chance. If you want you can use Progressive Difficulty option to unlock the Insane level during the game, just enter any gameday at which the AI-Difficult level should increase.											
												Do you want to use the the Progressive Difficulty option now?
												
												(Dont forget to also choose your starting difficulty)
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops0:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Option to add additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game. Bigger stacks will also result in faster growth of neutrals.
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops1:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Easy - Adds additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game.
												
												 Level 1: 20
												 Level 2: 18
												 Level 3: 15
												 Level 4: 12
												Level 5:  8
												Level 6:  6
												Level 7:  5
												Level 8:  3
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops2:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Normal - Adds additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game.
												
												Level 1: 30
												Level 2: 25
												Level 3: 20
												Level 4: 15
												Level 5: 10
												Level 6:   8
												Level 7:   6
												Level 8:   4
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops3:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Hard - Adds additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game.
												
												Level 1: 40
												Level 2: 35
												Level 3: 30
												Level 4: 25
												Level 5: 20
												Level 6: 15
												Level 7: 10
												Level 8:   8
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops4:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Extreme - Adds additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game.
												
												Level 1: 70
												Level 2: 55
												Level 3: 50
												Level 4: 45
												Level 5: 40
												Level 6: 30
												Level 7: 20
												Level 8: 12
Diff_Mod.Additionals_troops5:
{Starting Stack Size Option}
			
												Insane - Adds additional troops to every neutral stack on the map at the beginning of the game.
												
												 Level 1: 120
												Level 2:  80
												Level 3:  70
												Level 4:  60
												Level 5:  50
												Level 6:  40
												Level 7:  30
												Level 8:  20
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats0:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Option to set the rate at which neutral stacks gain att/def/HP over time. This setting should be used for better scaling of neutral units during the later stages of the game. Using this option will automatically activate the {Neutral Unit Bonuses} option.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats1:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Easy - Increases the Attack, Defense and Health of any neutral stack by additional +1/+1/+5% points for every {~r}6{~} weeks.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats2:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Normal - Increases the Attack, Defense and Health of any neutral stack by additional +1/+1/+5% points for every {~r}4{~} weeks.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats3:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Hard - Increases the Attack, Defense and Health of any neutral stack by additional +1/+1/+5% points for every {~r}2{~} weeks.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats4:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Extreme - Increases the Attack, Defense and Health of any neutral stack by additional +1/+1/+5% points for every {~r}1{~} weeks.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_stats5:
{Neutrals Stats Gain Option}
			
												Insane - Increases the Attack, Defense and Health of any neutral stack by additional +1/+1/+5% points for every {~r}3{~} days.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_exp:
{Neutral Stack Experience Option}
			
												Set the rate at which neutrals gain a rank in Stack Experience. The higher the difficulty, the faster neutral stacks will reach the Ace level. Using this option will automatically activate the {Neutral Stack Experience} option.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks0:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Option to increase the number of guards in creature banks and neutral towns also increases the Att/Def/Dmg/HP of commanders in creature banks. This setting should be used to make CB more of a challenge in the later stages of the game. Using this option will automatically activate the {Neutral Town and Creature Bank Growth} option.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks1:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Easy - Only increases the Att/Def/Dmg/HP of commanders in creature banks by a {~r}small{~} amount.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks2:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Normal - Increases the number of guards by a {~r}small{~} value and increases the power of the commander.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks3:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Hard - Increases the number of guards by a {~r}decent{~} value and increases the power of the commander further. With this level CB will be a good challenge.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks4:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Extreme - Increases the number of guards by a {~r}big{~} value and increases the power of the commander a lot. With this level you have to fight hard to take creature banks.
Diff_Mod.Creature_banks5:
{Creature Banks Growth Option}
			
												Insane - Increases the number of guards by a {~r}huge{~} value and makes the commander a real challenge after several weeks. You have been warned!
Diff_Mod.Random_Neutral_Hero:
{Random Neutral Hero Option}
			
												The chance for the random hero to appear is 100% instead of 25%. Using this option will automatically activate the {Random Neutral Hero} option.
Diff_Mod.Tougher_Karmic_Battles_on:
{Karmic Battle Option}
			
												It basically doubles the number of creatures you have to fight. The progession is still the same. Using this option will automatically activate the {Karmic Battle} option.
Diff_Mod.Low_Level_Growth:
{Low Level Growth Option}
			
												Every week all stacks on the map will get additional growth like this:
												
												Extra 10% Growth for Level 1 (20% per week in total)
												Extra  5% Growth for Level 2  (15% per week in total)
												Extra  4% Growth for Level 3  (14% per week in total)
												Extra  3% Growth for Level 4  (13% per week in total)
												Extra  2% Growth for Level 5  (12% per week in total)
Diff_Mod.Double_Growth_Rate:
{Double Growth Rate Option}
			
												Neutral stacks on the map will grow by 15% instead of 10% every week.
Diff_Mod.Double_Neutral_Stacks:
{Double Stack Size Option}
			
												Doubles the stack size of all neutral stacks on the map. You can also use this option later during the game if you want to increase your challenge towards the late game or increase experience reward.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Stack_Uptier1:
{Neutral Uptier Option}
			
												When the map starts all creatures will level up. It stops at level 6 creatures, so Unicorns will never become Green Dragons for example. On XL Maps the loading time can be up to one minute! So don't exit, it will work. It will not work for creatures that don't have a faction (neutrals).
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Stack_Weekly:
{Weekly Stack Upgrade Option}
			
												5% of all non-upgraded creatures will upgrade at the start of a new week. For example Gremlins will become Master Gremlins. This will be done until no unupgarded creature on the map is left. Usualy takes around 2 month.
Diff_Mod.Neutral_Growth_10000:
{Growth Beyond 4000 Option}
			
												This option removes the growth limit of 4000 for all stacks on the map.
												
												Level 1 units will grow up to 20000
												Level 2 units will grow up to 18000
												Level 3 units will grow up to 16000
												Level 4 units will grow up to 14000
												Level 5 units will grow up to 12000
												Level 6 units will grow up to 10000
												Level 7 units will grow up to 8000
Diff_Mod.Battle_Reward_Active:
{Battle Reward Option}
			
												This option will make your game easier and not more difficult. After choosing your difficulty settings you will see a number which is your chance to get a battle reward after a fight.
												Picking more options will increase your chance that after fights you will receive one of the following rewards: Experience, Resources, Primary Skills. A Battle Reward Chance above {~DodgerBlue}55%{~} will also give you a chance to learn spells. A chance above {~r}65%{~} will give you a small chance to find artifacts.
												The higher the score the more difficult your game will get. The chance can go over 100% which will mean you will receive a reward after every fight and the bonus is bigger as it would be if the chance is only 50%
												Some options, for example health,attack and defense bonus, will increase your score by a lot as some other will only increase it by a few percents.
Diff_Mod.Battle_Commander_Active:
{Battle Commander Option}
			
												The Battle Commander option (if activated) gives a chance that a neutral stack is guarded by a tough Commander. If you defeat this commander you get an extra reward from the fight. 
												The chance to encounter the Battle Commander starts when your hero reaches level 10 and is around 20%. The chance for the commander to appear is greater if your hero has a higher level. 
												The damage and health of the commander depends on the strength of your army, the level of your hero and some more things. So don't expect it to be easier at higher levels. I recommend this option for a single main-hero playstyle.
Diff_Mod.Anzahl_Buffs:
{Additional Enchantments Option}
			
												Will apply up to {4} random spells to neutrals, to increase the difficulty of combats.
Diff_Mod.Anzahl_Abilities:
{Additional Abilities Option}
			
												This option is currently disabled because it can cause a bug.
Diff_Mod.quantity_0: Quantity of creatures which will be added to Ai' heroes in every {occupied} slot.
Diff_Mod.Payday_Text_1: Payday - Set gameday at which AI starts to get bonus.
Diff_Mod.Out_Range_1: Value out of Range! Payday set to day 15.
Diff_Mod.Be_carefull:
{~r}Be carefull{~}

												A strong Commander leads the enemy ranks!
Diff_Mod.A glorius victory:
{~r}A glorius victory{~}

												Defeating the Battle Commander %Z-10 is rewared with:
Diff_Mod.A glorius victory2:
{~r}A glorius victory{~}

												Defeating the Battle Commander %Z-10 gains some of the Experience points required for the next level:
Diff_Mod.Battle Reward1:
{~r}Battle Reward{~}

												%Z-10 is rewared with some resources:
Diff_Mod.Battle Reward2:
{~r}Battle Reward{~}

												Winning the fight %Z-10 is rewared with:
Diff_Mod.Battle Reward3:
{~r}Battle Reward{~}

												Winning the fight %Z-10 gains some of the experience points required for the next level:
Diff_Mod.Battle Reward4:
{~r}Battle Reward{~}

												Winning the fight %Z-10 learns a new spell:
Diff_Mod.Battle Reward5:
{~r}Battle Reward{~}

												Winning the fight %Z-10 gets an artifact:
Diff_Mod.Progressive_Text_1: Progressive Difficulty - Set gameday at which difficulty should increase.
Diff_Mod.Out_Range_1: Value out of Range! Payday set to day 15.
Diff_Mod.Out_Range_2: Value out of Range! Progressive Difficulty set to day 57 (Beginning of month 3).
Diff_Mod.Redo_Options: Are you sure you want to set new difficulty settings? If you click {yes} all settings from map start will be reset and you can make new ones.
Diff_Mod.Difficulty_Disabled: Difficulty Mod disabled, no bonus for AI and Neutrals.
Diff_Mod.AI_Recover_Losses:
{AI Recover Losses}
			
												The computer player recovers {50%} of any lost units in combat vs neutral stacks. If a unit is killed completely it will not be recovered.
Diff_Mod.AI_Useful_Spells:
{AI Useful Spells}
			
												When the Payday is reached each AI hero will get a spell book and the following spells for free: {Haste}, {Slow}, {Cure} and {Curse}
Diff_Mod.AI_has_no_DD:
{AI no Dimension Door}
			
												To avoid lag on big maps the Dimension Door spells for all computer players will be replaced to fly. This should reduce loading time for AI between rounds.
Diff_Mod.AI_Artifacts_Eq:
{AI Artifact Equipment}
			
												AI always tries to equip the best artifact for every slot. Usually, the AI would not consider better artifacts when the slot is already occupied, no matter what is equipped. The artifacts are selected from a priority list. For example, if the AI finds the Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment in a Utopia and currently has the Skull Helmet equipped, it will put it in his backpack and equip the Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment instead.
Diff_Mod.Mixed_Neutrals_Missing:
Attention!

												Setting the Mixed Neutrals options requires the Mixed Neutrals Mod to be active in Mod Manger. Please download and activate the mod first, it is not included in the Difficulty-Mod
Diff_Mod.Slot_Example:
{Mixed Creatures Preview}
			
												Preview of the possible mixing of neutral stacks. The preview is not necessarily correct and does not consider every option. The generation of monsters is random, so just because you can see 7 different monster types in the preview does not mean that the stack always has to be mixed like that.
Diff_Mod.Option_20_Info:
{Minimal Mixing}
			
												This option sets the minimum number of different monsters in a stack on the adventure map, where 1 means all monsters are the same and 7 means that there must be at least 7 different types of monsters in the stack.
Diff_Mod.Option_21_Info:
{Maximal Mixing}
			
												This option sets the maximum number of different monsters in a stack on the adventure map, where 1 means all monsters are the same and 4 means that there are a maximum of 4 different types of monsters in the stack.
Diff_Mod.Option_22_Info:
{General Stack Size}
			
												The general stack size modifier increases the number of monsters you have to fight. A value of 150% means that at map start a stack of 100 neutral monsters is increased to 150 monsters. This applies to the computer player and the human player aswell.
Diff_Mod.Option_24_Info:
{Only Same Faction Mixing}
			
												When using this option only monsters of the same faction are generated. For example, when attacking a stack of Royal Griffins they will only be mixed with units from Castle and no other faction.
Diff_Mod.Option_25_Info:
{Allied Factions Mixing}
			
												When using this option only monsters of the same faction and all their allied factions are generated. This will expand the range of monsters that are mixed together. A list of all allied factions can be found in the readme file. For example, Castle has 33% chance to have Rampart ally and Inferno has 25% chance of Necropolis ally and 25% chance of Dungeon ally. Values can be edited by the player.
Diff_Mod.Option_26_Info:
{No Neutral Monsters}
			
												When using this option all Wog neutral monsters will be assigned to a faction or town and so can be generated in the mixing.
Diff_Mod.Option_27_Info:
{Neutrals Never Escape}
			
												With this option neutral monster stacks on the adventure map will never escape before the battle and are always willing to fight.
Diff_Mod.Option_28_Info:
{Include Third Upgrade Mod Monsters}
			
												This option will also include newly added monsters, like from the Third Upgrade Mod, in the pool of possible monsters that are generated. If the Third Upgrade Mod is not enabled, this option cannot be activated.
Diff_Mod.Option_29_Info:
{New Monster Preview Window}
			
												Enables a new window for right-clicking monsters on the adventure map, which replaces the standard one. The new window contains more information about the monsters and will give you a preview about all mixed monsters.
Diff_Mod.Option_30_Info:
{View Exact Quantity}
			
												When viewing monsters with right-click in the adventure map it will tell you the exact number of creatures instead of only Several, Lots, Horde and so on.
Diff_Mod.Option_31_Info:
{Aggression modifier}
			
												Set the value to add to each neutrals group aggression on adventure map. -10 means Compliant, +10 means Savage.
Diff_Mod.Option_33_Info:
{Minimum Low Level Difference}
			
												Sets the minimum relative level difference (-6...0) for generated monsters, as compared to base monster level. For example, if you set the value to -1, a stack of Griffins (level 3) will never be mixed together with level 1 units. If you set the value to -6-low  and 6-high theoretically the full range of monsters is allowed for generation.
Diff_Mod.Option_34_Info:
{Maximum High Level Difference}
			
												Sets the maximum relative level difference (6...0) for generated monsters, as compared to base monster level. For example, if you set the value to +2, a stack of Griffins (level 3) will never be mixed together with Champions (level 6) or Angels (level 7). If you set the value to -6-low  and 6-high theoretically the full range of monsters is allowed for generation.
Diff_Mod.Cancel_Mixed_Settings: Exit and reset all Mixed Neutral settings to default value from the json files and close dialogue.
